title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 4, 2019).

British lawmakers delivered a blow to Johnson's strategy with a vote aimed at delaying Brexit, prompting the prime minister to call for a general election.

China's top office for Hong Kong affairs said it had legal power to unilaterally declare a state of emergency in the city if unrest continues.

Hurricane Dorian began whipping Florida after carving a slow, erratic path across the Atlantic and devastating the Bahamas.

The gunman in Saturday's shooting spree in Texas was barred under federal law from owning or buying firearms, according to authorities.

Pope Francis ordered Vatican officials to get the Holy See's budget under control after a doubling of the deficit in 2018.

Emails among USC officials show the school weighed how much families could donate amid admissions deliberations.

The administration is considering continuing a special refugee program for some Iraqis while further reducing the cap on other refugees.

The search for survivors from a diving boat that burned and sank off the California coast was called off, with 34 people presumed dead.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 04, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
